multiple_choice.choice: is formed between two amino groups.
is formed between two carboxyl groups.
is the product of a condensation reaction.

response.feedback: Incorrect. If amino acids combined between amino groups, that wouldn’t leave any amino groups left to elongate the chain of amino acids.
Incorrect. If amino acids combined between carboxyl groups, it wouldn’t leave any carboxyl groups left to elongate the chain of amino acids.
Correct. By using one amino and one carboxyl group from each amino acid, the chain can continue to elongate.
Incorrect. The peptide bond occurs between the more electronegative nitrogen and less electronegative carbon, making it a polar bond.
